result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Lynn Turner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond previously posted in the amount of $250.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: JOC Returned - Return to Sender Unknown

Case Called @ 11:07 AM: Defendant Steven Lynn Turner in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA recites resolution.  Def and counsel confirm request.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  15TR-1793 DRI.  Statement by Def:  Yes, apologizes to Court.  The Court:  Accepts resolution and Imposes Court Costs w/Surcharge - bond to be applied - 60 DTP or PP.  Sample to be provided today.  Expungement process of DNA record explained through DOJ.  Appeal Rights Given.
No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Case Called @ 3:08 PM: Defendant Steven Lynn Turner in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP received and entered as to both matters.   Per SPD:  Offer extended on resolution with Valid DL.  Request P/S be scheduled at the end of October.  P/S Scheduled as requested - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 11:30 am.
